QuestionStem: The research conducted by Rosalind Franklin, Erwin Chargaff, James Watson, and Francis Crick led to the discovery of DNA.

images.caption: X-ray crystallographer Rosalind Franklin, circa 1942.
images.altText: This photograph shows Rosalind Franklin using a microscope.

images.caption: Biochemist Erwin Chargaff, circa 1970.
images.altText: This photograph shows researcher Edwin Chargaff.

images.caption: James Watson (left) and Francis Crick (right), in their laboratory, circa 1953.
images.altText: In this photograph, James Watson and Frances Crick display a model of DNA's structure.
